headline: Vistra Meta Nuclear Deal Recasts Growth Story Around Long Term Data Power
summary: Vistra (NYSE:VST) has entered into 20 year zero carbon nuclear power agreements with Meta. The deals cover more than 2,600 MW of carbon free nuclear energy output. The agreements are described as the largest nuclear uprates backed by a U.S. corporate customer to date. Vistra comes into this announcement with its shares at $171.49 and a very large 3 year return, close to 7x, and a 5 year return that is also very large. The stock is up 14.6% over the past week and 3.8% year to date, and these...
